meanings.definition: The practice of giving unfair preferential treatment to one person or group over others.
meanings.sent1: The teacher showed favoritism towards the student who always brought her an apple.
meanings.sent2: The manager's favoritism towards certain employees created tension among the team.
meanings.sent3: The favoritism towards the class pet hamster led to it being crowned 'Most Popular' in the school.
meanings.sent4: In the world of sports, favoritism can be the deciding factor in who gets chosen for the team.
meanings.sent5: The favoritism shown by the judge towards the contestant was evident to everyone in the audience.

meanings.definition: The state of being a favorite or preferred choice.
meanings.sent1: Her favoritism for vanilla ice cream made it the top-selling flavor at the shop.
meanings.sent2: The singer's favoritism among fans earned her the title of 'Queen of Pop'.
meanings.sent3: The cat's favoritism for the red ball made it the most sought-after toy in the house.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, favoritism towards certain designers can make or break their careers.
meanings.sent5: The favoritism of the audience towards the comedian made him a regular performer at the comedy club.
